profile.name: Rohit Lad
profile.one_line_summary: Applied ML & simulation engineer with 7+ years building high-performance simulation, optimization and production ML/data platforms at Airbus; bridges numerical methods, MLOps and pragmatic software delivery.

professional_story.narrative: Rohit is an engineer who started in mechanical engineering and numerical simulation, then layered optimization, high-performance simulation and AI to become a cross-cutting technical lead in Data Science and ML for aerospace manufacturing and defense. Early work focused on trajectory planning, numerical optimization and parallel simulation (128-core platforms) for operational analysis; later he moved into production ML and analytics—building data pipelines, RAG-based search/troubleshooting assistants, and enterprise dashboards used daily by manufacturing teams. He combines rigorous math/numerical reasoning with pragmatic software engineering and product-minded delivery, producing measurable business value (enterprise tools delivering ~€300K, platforms used by 1,400+ daily users). This is a profile of a builder who comfortably moves from research-grade algorithms to robust, monitored production systems while mentoring cross-cultural teams.
professional_story.why_it_matters: Unites deep technical rigor (PDEs, RL, QP, parallel computing) with product delivery and domain knowledge in aerospace/manufacturing—ideal for roles needing both algorithmic creativity and shipping reliable, high-impact systems.

unified_skills.skill: Supervised learning (classification & regression)
unified_skills.sources: Projects, Certifications, Airbus Data Scientist role.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Thesis & projects reference ML for classification (medical image decision tree project, Coursera ML); professional role lists classification & regression tasks for domain-specific problems.

unified_skills.skill: Deep learning (CNNs, RNNs/sequence models, transfer learning)
unified_skills.sources: Deep Learning Specialization, AI for Medical Diagnosis, project list (medical image classification), tools: Keras/TensorFlow.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Completed DL specialization covering CNNs/sequence models and lists Keras/TensorFlow as tools; applied to medical image classification project.

unified_skills.skill: LLMs, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and vector search
unified_skills.sources: Resume projects and current role mention RAG, vector embedding & retrieval, context-based AI search engine, and 2025 CrewAI certification.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Explicit mention of RAG and vector embedding; recent certification on multi-agent/LLM orchestration suggests up-to-date practical knowledge of LLM tooling and orchestration patterns.

unified_skills.skill: Reinforcement learning & custom RL environments
unified_skills.sources: Created custom RL environment for autonomous agents; Deep Learning specialization + projects.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Listing of RL environment creation implies knowledge of environment design (OpenAI Gym-like APIs), reward shaping, training pipelines and simulation integration.

unified_skills.skill: Model evaluation, validation and production monitoring
unified_skills.sources: Production ML responsibilities and enterprise tool delivery; mentorship in production-grade NLP solutions.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Deploying tools used by 1,400+ users and delivering business value requires monitoring, validation metrics, and operational evaluation (drift detection, performance SLAs).

unified_skills.skill: Feature engineering, data labeling and dataset maintenance
unified_skills.sources: Data pipelines for ontology objects, dataset scheduling & maintenance in projects.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Building pipelines and maintaining datasets implies experience in feature extraction, label hygiene, dataset versioning and ETL for ML.

unified_skills.skill: NLP techniques beyond LLMs (classification, domain-specific text processing)
unified_skills.sources: Resume mentions domain-specific classification & NLP solutions, Coursera NLP exposure in DL specialization.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Implementing contextual search & domain classification indicates knowledge of tokenization, embeddings, fine-tuning, intent classification and evaluation.

unified_skills.skill: MLOps & model deployment (pipelines, Docker, monitoring, orchestration)
unified_skills.sources: Tools list (Docker, AWS), deployment of enterprise tools, mentoring on NLP productionization.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Production systems and Docker/AWS usage imply containerization, CI/CD, environment reproducibility, infrastructure as code familiarity and monitoring practices.

unified_skills.skill: Scalable ML (MPI, parallel training/inference design)
unified_skills.sources: Scalable CART with MPI project; high-performance simulation experience.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Implementing MPI-based algorithms requires understanding of distributed memory parallelism, communication patterns (MPI collectives), data partitioning and scaling trade-offs.

expertise_domains.domain_summary: Covers the full ML lifecycle from dataset engineering, classical & deep learning, to LLMs/RAG and production MLOps—applies at scale for enterprise aerospace/manufacturing problems. Evidence: projects and role responsibilities show both research-grade algorithms and operational deployment.

unified_skills.skill: Numerical optimization methods (gradient-based, QP, MILP)
unified_skills.sources: Thesis topics, trajectory planning, formation flight using quadratic programming, tests with MILP and other techniques.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Developed QP-based formation algorithms and tested MILP/informed sampling — implies mastery of convex/non-convex optimization, solvers (IPOPT, Gurobi/CVX), and constraint handling.

unified_skills.skill: High-performance computing & parallel simulation (MPI, multi-core scaling)
unified_skills.sources: 128-core parallel simulations; MPI-based CART project.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Running simulations across 128 cores and MPI projects shows competence in parallelizing code, profiling, memory usage and distributed scheduling.

unified_skills.skill: Physics-based modeling (guidance, sensors, radar, flight dynamics)
unified_skills.sources: Modeled missile guidance, sensor arrays, radar simulations and air-to-air combat maneuvers.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Creating physics-based models demands domain knowledge (kinematics, dynamics), signal processing for sensors, and integrating these into simulation frameworks.

unified_skills.skill: Trajectory planning & distributed consensus algorithms
unified_skills.sources: Flight trajectory planning for swarm, distributed consensus algorithm, formation flight project.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Implies knowledge of continuous trajectory generation, collision avoidance heuristics, re-planning, and multi-agent coordination.

unified_skills.skill: Simulation system engineering (scenario design, edge-case testing, resilience)
unified_skills.sources: Built simulation frameworks to test algorithm resilience and scenario analysis.
unified_skills.inference_chain: Developing simulation frameworks requires test harnesses, scenario generation, fault injection (comm delays, sensor faults), and result reproducibility.

expertise_domains.domain_summary: Expertise spans mathematical foundations (PDEs, optimization), building and scaling simulations, and translating simulation outputs into operational insights—directly applied in defense/aerospace contexts.

expertise_domains.domain_summary: Demonstrated capability to lead technical efforts, mentor engineers and translate engineering work into measurable business impact in large organizations.

high_level_accomplishments: Led digital transformation initiatives delivering intuitive KPI dashboards for aircraft managers and cross-program teams; enabled data-driven decision making.
Served as Technical Lead for multiple enterprise tools with reported €300K business value; managed code reviews, merges, deployments and strategic roadmaps.
Architected data extraction and transformation pipelines supporting ontology objects for aircraft assembly quality control with 1,400+ daily active users.
Mentored international talent and advised on advanced NLP solutions including RAG and vector search.
inferred_responsibilities: Define product requirements with manufacturing stakeholders, prioritize ML features and produce KPIs/SLAs.
Design and operate ETL pipelines, dataset governance, and production monitoring for ML models and dashboards.
Run cross-team code-review processes and enforce engineering practices (testing, CI/CD).

impact_metrics.user_metrics: 1,400+ daily active users on manufacturing operations tools.

experience_timeline.role: Software Engineer - Artificial Intelligence, Modeling & Simulation
high_level_accomplishments: Led development of a parallel air-combat simulation platform executing across 128 cores and reduced scenario analysis time from weeks to days.
Developed tactical planning algorithms, behavior trees and weapon allocation optimization improving simulation granularity.
Modeled missile guidance, sensor arrays and radar simulations achieving 75% speedup over prior benchmarks.
Built custom RL environment for training autonomous agents and mentored junior engineers.
inferred_responsibilities: Architect high-performance simulation frameworks, parallelize compute-bound workloads, and profile/optimize performance.
Translate operational requirements into simulation scenarios and validate models against benchmarks.
Integrate AI components (RL agents, planning algorithms) into simulation pipelines.

experience_timeline.role: Software Engineer - Algorithms & Trajectory Planning (via Modis GmbH)
high_level_accomplishments: Developed decentralized UAV formation flight algorithm with high-order continuous trajectory planning using quadratic programming.
Tested path planning algorithms (MILP, potential fields, informed sampling) and built resilient simulation frameworks for edge-case analysis.
inferred_responsibilities: Prototype and validate trajectory planning approaches, perform numerical stability analysis, and simulate sensor/communication faults.

projects.title: Scalable CART Decision Tree for Medical Image Classification (MPI)
projects.explicit_description: Scalable CART Decision Tree algorithm for medical image classification using MPI.

deep_dive.technical_scope: Parallel decision tree training across MPI nodes, handling data partitioning, aggregation of splits, and scalability challenges.
inferred_skills: MPI programming, parallel IO, balancing compute vs communication, memory-efficient data structures
Statistical understanding of CART splitting criteria, pruning and cross-validation
deep_dive.impact: Demonstrates practical experience scaling traditional algorithms for large image datasets and bridging HPC with ML pipelines.

projects.title: Context-based AI Search Engine / Troubleshooting Non-Conformity Assistant
projects.explicit_description: RAG-based contextual search engine for troubleshooting non-conformity in production; vector embedding and retrieval.

deep_dive.technical_scope: Document ingestion, chunking, embedding generation, vector index management, retrieval + LLM prompt orchestration, UI/UX integration into FAL teams.
inferred_skills: Embedding selection, index tuning, prompt engineering, hallucination mitigation, evaluation (retrieval precision/recall)
Operationalization: scalable inference, latency constraints, logging/citation tracing for audits
deep_dive.impact: Enables frontline manufacturing teams to find contextual troubleshooting info, reducing time to resolution and standardizing knowledge access.

projects.title: Flight trajectory planning for swarms & formation flight algorithms
projects.explicit_description: Distributed consensus algorithms and quadratic programming for formation flight and swarm trajectory planning.

deep_dive.technical_scope: Continuous high-order trajectory generation, collision avoidance, re-planning under constraints, numerical stability and optimization solver integration.
inferred_skills: Control theory basics, convex optimization, solver interfacing, multi-agent coordination and robustness analysis
deep_dive.impact: Practical demonstration of designing algorithms robust to real-world communication and sensor uncertainties.

projects.title: BlipHQ (archived) & SkillOutreach (SaaS)
projects.explicit_description: BlipHQ: single API for real-time notifications to messaging platforms. SkillOutreach: AI SaaS for generating personalized LinkedIn outreach and discovering candidate emails.

deep_dive.technical_scope: API design, OAuth integrations, webhook handling, background workers, user management, email discovery integrations and message personalization via ML/templating.
inferred_skills: SaaS architecture, product-market fit experiments, user onboarding metrics, secure third-party integrations and scaling considerations
deep_dive.impact: Shows product-building instincts and the ability to ship customer-facing features outside of corporate contexts.

education.notes: Published research on modal analysis with two papers on vibration of plates.

domain_patterns_recognized: Research → Production trajectory: Started with academically deep simulation/optimization work and progressively moved to production ML/data platforms (thesis → defense simulation → Airbus ML tooling).
Scale-first mindset: multiple references to parallelization (128 cores, MPI) and enterprise-scale usage (1,400+ DAU), indicating attention to performance and operational constraints.
Product and impact orientation: repeated quantification of business value and user metrics (€300K, 1,400+ DAU) reveals bias toward measurable outcomes.

cross_domain_capabilities.technical_translation: Converts mathematical and simulation research into production code and scalable services (PDEs/optimization → ML pipelines → dashboards).
cross_domain_capabilities.systems_thinking: Understands end-to-end implications: from solver convergence and numerical stability to user-facing latency and maintainability.
cross_domain_capabilities.mentorship_to-leadership: Mentors juniors and leads technical initiatives without necessarily being in a formal people-manager role—evidence of emergent leadership.

hidden_strengths: Bridging HPC and ML: Rare combination of MPI/Multi-core HPC experience together with modern ML/LLM pipelines—valuable for scaling large-model or simulation-augmented ML.
Operationalizing research: Strong pattern of delivering research ideas into tools that generate measurable business value.
Domain trustworthiness: Working on manufacturing quality-control ontology objects and defense simulations implies rigorous validation, conservative design and audit-readiness.
Rapid learning & recency: Continuous upskilling (2019–2025 certifications and modern RAG/Agent work) shows fast adoption of new paradigms.

growth_trajectory.past: Mechanical engineering & simulation researcher → algorithm & trajectory planner → parallel simulation & RL developer at defense → transition to production ML and data platform technical lead at Airbus.
growth_trajectory.near_term: Likely to move into senior ML engineering, MLOps/ML platform roles, or lead architect positions bridging ML research and enterprise deployment.
growth_trajectory.long_term: Could scale into Head of ML/AI Engineering or Principal Engineer roles for organizations requiring both deep algorithmic capability and production delivery at scale.

meta_skills: Learning agility — quickly adopting and certifying in new AI paradigms (LLMs/Agents).
Bridging theory and practice — converts research into deployable products with measurable ROI.
Systemic thinking — designs solutions considering numeric stability, performance and user operations together.

publications_and_artifacts: Master thesis: Weather Avoidance Algorithm for Remotely Piloted Aircraft (RWTH/Airbus).
Scalable Decision Tree report, Heliostat Field Optimization report (links on personal site).
Two papers on vibration/modal analysis from B.E. research.

online_presence.github_or_code: Not explicit in resume; web portfolio likely contains code/artifacts (personal site).
